title: Short Answer: English Vocabulary and Usage
description: Answer these questions with short, precise responses to test your English knowledge.

questions.question: What is the past tense of the verb 'swim'?
hints: Think about the vowel change pattern
questions.explanation: The past tense of 'swim' is 'swam'. This follows the pattern of irregular verbs like ring-rang, sing-sang.

questions.question: What word describes a person who writes novels?
questions.explanation: A novelist is someone who writes novels. Author and writer are also acceptable broader terms.

questions.question: What is the comparative form of the adjective 'good'?
questions.explanation: The comparative form of 'good' is 'better', not 'gooder'. This is an irregular comparative form.

questions.question: What do you call a group of sheep?
questions.explanation: A group of sheep is called a 'flock'. 'Herd' is also sometimes used, though it's more commonly associated with cattle.

questions.question: What is the plural form of 'child'?
questions.explanation: The plural of 'child' is 'children'. This is an irregular plural form that doesn't follow standard rules.

questions.question: What word means 'afraid of heights'?
hints: It comes from Greek 'akron' meaning height
questions.explanation: Someone afraid of heights is 'acrophobic' or has 'acrophobia'. The term comes from Greek roots.

questions.question: What is the third person singular present of 'have'?
questions.explanation: The third person singular present form of 'have' is 'has' (he has, she has, it has).

questions.question: What punctuation mark is used to show possession?
hints: It looks like a comma but higher up
questions.explanation: An apostrophe (') is used to show possession (John's book) and in contractions (don't, can't).
